greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Alternate A022941 and A143344.
comment: Eric Angelini's definition was: start with 1,2,3; then alternately adjoin either the sum of the last two terms or the smallest number not yet in the sequence.
link: M. F. Hasler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2001
program: (PARI) f="b156031.txt"; used=[]; write(f,c=1," ",b=1);a=1; for(i=1,1e3, used=setunion(used,Set(a+=b)); while(setsearch(used,b++), used=setminus(used,Set(b))); write(f,c++," "a"\n",c++," "b)) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 01 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 01 2009, based on a posting by Eric Angelini to the Sequence Fans Mailing List
